description: Single source of truth for all format variation dimensions. Used by variation_planner.py to generate variation_plan.json per run.

overwhelm.label: Overwhelm Hook
overwhelm.description: Open with category confusion and jargon overload
overwhelm.template: {category} in {year} is more confusing than ever. {jargon_a}, {jargon_b}, {jargon_c}. So which one is actually worth your money?

mystery.label: Mystery Hook
mystery.description: Tease the winner without revealing, create curiosity gap
mystery.template: One of these five {category} destroyed the competition. The other four? Not even close. I tested all of them so you don't have to.

anti_shill.label: Anti-Shill Hook
anti_shill.description: Open by calling out fake reviews and positioning as honest
anti_shill.template: Most {category} reviews are paid ads disguised as opinions. I bought these five with my own money and I'm going to tell you what they won't.

meta_complaint.label: Meta Complaint Hook
meta_complaint.description: Open with a relatable frustration about buying in this category
meta_complaint.template: I spent three hours reading {category} reviews last week and ended up more confused than when I started. Sound familiar?

price_shock.label: Price Shock Hook
price_shock.description: Lead with surprising price differences to grab attention
price_shock.template: The cheapest one here costs {low_price}. The most expensive? {high_price}. But the best one isn't the most expensive. Not even close.

personal_fail.label: Personal Fail Hook
personal_fail.description: Open with a personal bad purchase experience
personal_fail.template: I wasted {amount} on a terrible {category_singular} last year. So this time I tested five of them properly. Here's what actually works.

stat_hook.label: Statistics Hook
stat_hook.description: Open with a surprising data point about the category
stat_hook.template: {stat_fact} about {category}. That's why I tested the top five and ranked them on what actually matters.

contrarian.label: Contrarian Hook
contrarian.description: Challenge a common belief about the category
contrarian.template: Everyone says {common_belief} about {category}. After testing five of them for two weeks, I think they're wrong.

classic_countdown.label: Classic Countdown (#5 to #1)
classic_countdown.description: Standard ranking from worst to best, building anticipation

winner_first.label: Winner First (Reveal + Context)
winner_first.description: Reveal the winner immediately, then explain why through the rankings
winner_first.segment_flow: HOOK → WINNER_TEASE → CREDIBILITY → CRITERIA → 5×(INTRO+DEMO+REVIEW+RANK) → WINNER_REINFORCEMENT → ENDING_DECISION

tier_system.label: Tier System (Budget/Mid/Premium)
tier_system.description: Group products by price tier instead of strict ranking
tier_system.segment_flow: HOOK → CREDIBILITY → CRITERIA → TIER_BREAK(budget) → products → TIER_BREAK(mid) → products → TIER_BREAK(premium) → products → WINNER_REINFORCEMENT → ENDING_DECISION

problem_first.label: Problem First
problem_first.description: Open with the buyer's problem, then present solutions ranked

head_to_head.label: Head-to-Head Comparisons
head_to_head.description: Compare products in pairs before final ranking
head_to_head.segment_flow: HOOK → CREDIBILITY → CRITERIA → COMPARISON(5v4) → COMPARISON(3v2) → INTRO+DEMO+REVIEW(1) → WINNER_REINFORCEMENT → ENDING_DECISION

surprise_pick.label: Surprise Pick Reveal
surprise_pick.description: Tease that the winner is unexpected, build to the surprise
surprise_pick.segment_flow: HOOK → CREDIBILITY → CRITERIA → 4×(INTRO+DEMO+REVIEW+RANK+FORWARD_HOOK) → SURPRISE_PICK → INTRO+DEMO+REVIEW+RANK → WINNER_REINFORCEMENT → ENDING_DECISION

classic_top5.label: Classic Top 5
classic_top5.description: Traditional ranked countdown with balanced coverage.
script_rules: Use one clear verdict sentence per product.

buy_skip_upgrade.label: Buy / Skip / Upgrade
buy_skip_upgrade.description: Each product gets an explicit buy/skip/upgrade verdict.
script_rules: For each product, include one explicit verdict: BUY, SKIP, or UPGRADE.
Justify verdict using one concrete trade-off statement.

persona_top3.label: Top Picks by Persona
persona_top3.description: Map products to user personas and use-case fit.
script_rules: For each product, identify the best-fit buyer persona.
In recap, map winners for at least 3 personas.

one_winner_two_alts.label: One Winner + 2 Alternatives
one_winner_two_alts.description: Declare one winner and two practical alternatives.
script_rules: Declare one clear winner and exactly two alternatives.
Explain why the other products did not qualify as alternatives.

budget_vs_premium.label: Budget vs Premium
budget_vs_premium.description: Split recommendations by budget and premium tiers.
budget_vs_premium.chapter_pattern: intro + budget lane + premium lane + final recommendation
script_rules: Assign each product to budget/mid/premium lane.
Recommend one budget-safe pick and one premium pick.

classic_4seg.label: Classic 4-Segment
classic_4seg.description: INTRO → DEMO → REVIEW → RANK per product

comparison_lead.label: Comparison Lead
comparison_lead.description: Open each product by comparing to previous, then demo and rank

problem_solution.label: Problem-Solution
problem_solution.description: Frame each product as solving a specific problem

rapid_fire.label: Rapid Fire
rapid_fire.description: Condensed blocks for faster pacing, fewer segments per product

clean_studio.label: Clean Studio
clean_studio.description: Neutral background, product hero shots, minimal distractions
clean_studio.dzine_direction: clean studio background, product centered, soft lighting, minimal props

lifestyle_broll.label: Lifestyle B-Roll
lifestyle_broll.description: Products shown in real usage scenarios
lifestyle_broll.dzine_direction: realistic lifestyle scene, product in active use, natural lighting, everyday environment

spec_cards.label: Spec Cards + Overlays
spec_cards.description: Data-driven visual style with specs and comparison overlays
spec_cards.dzine_direction: product on neutral background with space for text overlays, spec card layout, clean 16:9

split_screen.label: Split-Screen Comparisons
split_screen.dzine_direction: split-screen comparison layout, two products side by side, matching angles

unboxing_style.label: Unboxing/Hands-On
unboxing_style.description: Close-up hands-on shots, packaging, first impressions
unboxing_style.dzine_direction: close-up hands-on shot, product being held or unboxed, desk surface visible

standard.label: Standard
standard.description: Clear, measured delivery. Good for detailed reviews.

fast_energy.label: Fast Energy
fast_energy.description: Upbeat, quick-paced. Good for countdown and hype.

deliberate.label: Deliberate
deliberate.description: Slower, authoritative. Good for premium/technical products.

conversational.label: Conversational
conversational.description: Natural, like talking to a friend. Good for lifestyle categories.

soft_subscribe.label: Soft Subscribe
soft_subscribe.line: If this helped you decide, subscribing lets me keep testing stuff like this.

question_engage.label: Question Engage
question_engage.line: Which one would you pick? Drop it in the comments. I read every single one.

save_for_later.label: Save for Later
save_for_later.line: Save this video for when you're ready to buy. The links stay updated.

next_video_tease.label: Next Video Tease
next_video_tease.line: Next week I'm testing {next_category}. Subscribe so you don't miss it.

community_poll.label: Community Poll
community_poll.line: Vote in the poll above. I'll review whatever wins next month.

challenge.label: Challenge
challenge.line: Try the winner for 30 days. Come back and tell me if I was right.

direct_link.label: Direct Link
direct_link.line: Links to everything are in the description with current prices.

personal_pick.label: Personal Pick
personal_pick.line: If you're asking what I'd buy with my own money, it's the {winner}. Links below.

standard.label: Standard
standard.text: This video contains affiliate links. If you buy through them, I earn a small commission at no extra cost to you. This video was produced with AI assistance.

transparent.label: Transparent
transparent.text: Full transparency: the links below are affiliate links. I earn a commission if you purchase. I bought every product myself and my opinions are my own. AI tools were used in production.

brief.label: Brief
brief.text: Affiliate links in description. AI-assisted production.

ftc_detailed.label: FTC Detailed
ftc_detailed.text: Material Connection Disclosure: This video contains affiliate links to products. If you click and purchase, I receive a commission. All products were independently purchased and tested. Opinions are my own. This content was produced with AI assistance including script generation and image creation.

sponsored_base.label: Sponsored Base
sponsored_base.text: This video is sponsored by {sponsor}. All opinions are my own and I was not required to give a positive review. Additional affiliate links in the description. AI tools were used in production.

marketing_angles._description: Fogarty two-shot method: select an angle FIRST, then write the script through that lens. Each angle frames the entire video differently even with the same products.

value_hunter.label: Value Hunter
value_hunter.description: Frame everything through price-to-performance. Lead with what you get per dollar. Emphasize hidden costs and overlooked value.
value_hunter.prompt_injection: Frame every product evaluation through value-for-money. Lead with price-to-performance ratio. Highlight hidden costs competitors ignore. The viewer is budget-conscious but not cheap — they want the best deal, not the cheapest option.

problem_solver.label: Problem Solver
problem_solver.description: Start with a specific pain point the category solves. Each product is rated on how well it solves THAT problem.
problem_solver.prompt_injection: The viewer has a specific problem they need solved. Open with that problem. Rate every product primarily on how well it addresses that core pain point. Features that don't solve the problem get brief mention only.

upgrade_path.label: Upgrade Path
upgrade_path.description: Viewer already owns something in this category. Focus on what's better, what's changed, whether upgrading is worth it.
upgrade_path.prompt_injection: The viewer already owns a product in this category and is considering upgrading. Focus on what's genuinely improved vs previous generation. Be honest about whether the upgrade is worth it. Include 'if your current one still works, here's when to upgrade' framing.

first_timer.label: First-Time Buyer
first_timer.description: Viewer knows nothing about this category. Explain jargon. Focus on what actually matters vs marketing noise.
first_timer.prompt_injection: The viewer has never bought anything in this category before. They're overwhelmed by jargon and options. Cut through the noise. Explain what specs actually matter in plain language. Focus on 'what will you actually notice in daily use' over raw numbers.

pro_vs_consumer.label: Pro vs Consumer
pro_vs_consumer.description: Compare products through two lenses: what a professional needs vs what a casual user needs. Different winners for different use cases.
pro_vs_consumer.prompt_injection: Evaluate each product through two lenses: professional/power-user needs and casual/everyday needs. Be explicit that different viewers will have different winners. The pro pick and the consumer pick may be different products.

durability_test.label: Durability & Longevity
durability_test.description: Focus on build quality, warranty, long-term reliability. What will still work in 2 years?
durability_test.prompt_injection: Frame every evaluation through durability and longevity. What's the build quality like? What do long-term reviews say? What breaks first? Focus on 'will this still be good in 2 years' over flashy features.

gift_guide.label: Gift Guide
gift_guide.description: Viewer is buying for someone else. Focus on who each product is best for, ease of setup, wow factor.
gift_guide.prompt_injection: The viewer is buying this as a gift for someone else. Focus on who each product is perfect for (the minimalist, the tech enthusiast, the practical person). Emphasize unboxing experience, ease of setup, and wow factor. Include 'buy this one for...' framing.

honest_disappointment.label: Honest Disappointment
honest_disappointment.description: Lead with what disappointed you. Builds trust through radical honesty. The eventual recommendation hits harder.
honest_disappointment.prompt_injection: Lead each product review with what disappointed you or what the marketing got wrong. Be radically honest. This builds trust so that when you DO recommend something, the viewer believes you. Include at least one product you expected to love but didn't.

workflow_integration.label: Workflow Integration
workflow_integration.description: How each product fits into a real daily workflow. Focus on ecosystem, compatibility, setup friction.
workflow_integration.prompt_injection: Evaluate each product based on how it fits into a real daily workflow. How does it integrate with other devices? What's the setup friction? Does it play well with your existing ecosystem? Focus on real daily use, not isolated benchmarks.

spec_myth_buster.label: Spec Myth Buster
spec_myth_buster.description: Challenge misleading marketing specs. What specs actually matter vs what's just marketing.
spec_myth_buster.prompt_injection: Challenge the marketing specs that mislead buyers. Which numbers actually matter in real use? Which are inflated or meaningless? Bust at least one common myth about this category. Be the viewer's BS detector.

category_context._description: Per-category context docs (Fogarty method). Place .txt or .md files in config/category_context/{category_slug}/. Two files: offer_characteristics.md (product landscape, key differentiators, pricing tiers) and customer_avatar.md (who buys, pain points, desires, objections, language they use). These get injected into the LLM prompt for deep brand context.
category_context.fallback_prompt: Research this product category from a buyer's perspective. Consider: who buys these products, what problems they're solving, what they care about most, and what language they use when discussing purchases.

product_photography.reason: Superior material rendering (glass, metal, fabric), physically accurate lighting, multi-generation consistency

avatar_creative.reason: Better for creative/avatar shots, consistent Ray identity across products

workflow_notes: Upload reference image → set model → adjust lighting/background → generate variants
Product photography: focus on in-use scenes, not static. Clean backgrounds with negative space for overlays.
Thumbnail: 2 variants (A/B test), Ray as presenter + hero product
